sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>slide</radical> is <radical>dry</radical> at <kanji>noon</kanji>. The sun is brightest at noon, so it dries the morning dew off the slide, making noon the perfect time to slide.
meaningInfo: Picture all the kids out sliding on the slide at noon during their lunch break. It's hot and dry and they're very happy.
readingMnemonic: <kanji>Noon</kanji> also happens to be the time <reading>Go</reading>dzilla (<ja>ご</ja>) decided to attack for the same reasons: it's dry and kids are using the slide.
readingInfo: Watch in horror as Godzilla's giant foot crushes all the kids and their slide at exactly noon. You'd better go...
